etymology.description: 壴(壴) (zhù, "drum") + 支(支) (zhī, "hand holding drumstick") = drum being played -> drum
etymology.interpretation: The character 鼓(gǔ) combines a depiction of a drum 壴(壴) with a hand holding a drumstick 支(支). This intuitive combination directly represents the act of drumming.

examples.chinese: 音乐会开始时(音樂會開始時)，乐手敲鼓(樂手敲鼓)。
examples.pinyin: Yīnyuèhuì kāishǐ shí, yuèshǒu qiāo gǔ.
examples.english: When the concert begins, the musician beats the drum.
